data.title: Obituary for Dorothy Sparks
data.meta_description:

data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Dorothy Sparks | August 13, 2021 | Nacogdoches,TX
data.text:
Graveside service for Dorothy Vaughn Sparks will be at 2:00 PM on Monday, August 16, 2021, at Bethel Cemetery, with Bro. Shak Arrington officating.

Dorothy Vaughn Sparks, aged 74, died peacefully at home surrounded by family on August 13, 2021.

Dorothy was born on May 24, 1947 in Nacogdoches, TX to Finis Vaughn and Edith Vaughn Williams. She is preceded in death by her parents and four siblings: Gene Vaughn, Francis Scarborough, Finis Vaughn, and SheRita Kae Partin. She graduated from Garrison High School (class of 1965) and Massey Business College. Dorothy married her high school sweetheart John “Chick” Sparks on December 25, 1965 and celebrated 55 years together. For fifty-one years they worked a poultry farm. She was a member of Appleby Church of Christ.

Dorothy loved gardening, making sure her home was always surrounded by roses and azaleas. She learned to cook from her mother-in-law, Allie Bertie Sparks, and became locally famous for her outstanding cooking and baking. She was crafty and created numerous sewing, cross-stitching, and quilting projects. Dorothy was an active member of Beta Sigma Phi in the Xi Alpha Omicron chapter. She also stayed busy loving and caring for her grandchildren, from caretaking after school to cheering them on in their numerous extracurricular activities. Dorothy also loved to travel, especially with family.

Dorothy is survived by her husband, John Richard Sparks Sr. of Nacogdoches, TX; daughter Daphne Stanaland and her husband Bobby of Nacogdoches, TX; daughter Missy Sheldon and her husband Larry of Glassboro, NJ; son John Sparks Jr. and his wife Rachelle of Garrison, TX; grandchildren: Scott Robertson and his wife Jennifer of Marshall, TX; Seth Robertson of Dallas, TX; Shelby Kurklin and her husband Brian of Oklahoma City, OK; Susan Taylor and her husband Bradley of Henderson, TX; Kaelyn Taylor and her husband Lane of Nacogdoches, TX; Allie Sparks of Dallas, TX; Emily Sparks of Nacogdoches, TX; Riley Sparks of Garrison, TX; Lexi Whitworth and her husband Keaton of Groveton, TX; Brayden Frankens and fiancée Morgan Duren of Lufkin, TX; Sutton Frankens of Lufkin, TX; and Khash Frankens of Garrison, TX; Great-grandchildren: JayDe Robertson & Aubrey Robertson of Marshall, TX; and Connor Taylor of Marshall, TX.

The family would like for everyone to join them for a memorial visitation at North Street Church of Christ Family Life Center immediately following the graveside service.
